comment.author: 22891793@N03
comment._content: Yes a really talented photographer on a mission.  The government really had to sell women in the workplace hard during the war.  Photos that showed that women could work hard at mens jobs and still be ladies were important in entice more women to enter the workforce and getting men to accept the necessity.

comment._content:
I probably wouldn't be making this comment if I weren't saving a bunch of photos to print for a very young female person -- but if that's a modern vs historic title, it needs to be changed.  This worker is not a girl.  She's a woman.

(And yes, I love these photos.  This collection is a treasure.)

comment.author: 14745651@N00
comment._content:
they are posing because this particular photographer liked to carry a lot of lighting and studio gear with him on the road and the time needed to setup the shot, clean the set, pose the people, calculate the lighting, setup the 4x5 camera wouldn't allow the models to be totally spontaneous.

the studio lighting, attention to detail, and the use of kodachrome is also why the photos look fantastic.
